intro: Astragalus mehranensis, commonly known as Mehran milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Iran. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to drought conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its ecological significance is notable in its native habitat due to its ability to thrive in harsh environments.
